priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Cardiovascular Test Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101846

self.title: CDISC SDTM Cardiovascular Test Name Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist to describe the test name for a physiological examination of the cardiovascular system.
name: Cardiovascular Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Cardiovascular Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: An indication as to whether there is the presence of one or more aneurysms.
The peak velocity of the annular motion during late ventricular diastole (the active filling of the ventricle).
The peak velocity of the annular motion during early ventricular diastole (the passive filling of the ventricle).
The longitudinal displacement of a cardiac valve annulus toward the apex of the heart.
The peak velocity of the annular motion during ventricular systole.
The aortic augmentation index normalized to a heart rate of 75 beats per minute.
The augmentation pressure divided by the aortic pulse pressure (aortic systolic minus aortic diastolic pressure) multiplied by 100, expressed as a percentage.
The first pressure peak in the aortic wave form secondary to ventricular ejection.
The second pressure peak in the aortic waveform secondary to pressure wave reflection from the periphery.

The difference between the second pressure peak in the aortic wave, secondary to the pressure wave reflection from the sites of peripheral arterial impedance mismatch (P2) and the first pressure peak in the aortic wave form, secondary to ventricular ejection (P1).
An indication as to whether there is coarctation of the aorta.
The assessment of the severity of aortic coarctation.
The assessment of the severity of ductal aortic coarctation.
The assessment of the severity of postductal aortic coarctation.
The assessment of the severity of preductal aortic coarctation.
A relative measurement (ratio) of the aortic regurgitant jet width to left ventricular outflow tract (LVOT) diameter.
terms.preferredTerm: Aortic Regurgitant Jet Width to Left Ventricular Outflow Tract Diameter Ratio
terms.submissionValue: Aortic Regur Jet Width LVOT Diam Rt
synonyms: Aortic Regur Jet Width LVOT Diam Rt
Aortic Regurgitant Jet Width to Left Ventricular Outflow Tract Diameter Ratio

terms.definition: A measurement of the volume of retrograde blood flow across the orifice of the aortic valve expressed as a percentage of the anterograde flow volume.
The measured width of the regurgitant jet of blood into the left ventricular outflow tract.
A measurement of the volume of retrograde blood flow across the orifice of the aortic valve.
The area of the vena contracta of the aortic valve.
The width of the vena contracta of the aortic valve.
The 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary of a cardiovascular structure and measured at end ventricular diastole.
The 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary of a cardiovascular structure and measured at end ventricular systole.
The volume of blood per unit time passing through a specified location, such as a point in a blood vessel or an entire organ.
The measure of an individual's cardiac output divided by the individual's body surface area (CI= CO/BSA).
An indication as to whether there is a hypertrophied cardiac muscle.
The total volume of blood pumped by the heart over a set period of time, conventionally one minute; it is calculated as heart rate times stroke volume (CO= HR x SV).
The trajectory of the retrograde blood flow from a cardiac valve.
A description of the likely cause of the pathology responsible for the cardiac valve stenosis.
An estimation as to the cause of the pathology responsible for the cardiac valve regurgitation.
An indication as to whether a specific cardiac valve is regurgitant.
The qualitative measurement of the severity of cardiac valvular regurgitation.
An indication as to whether the cardiac valve in question has stenosis.
The qualitative measurement of the severity of cardiac valvular stenosis.
The assessment of the movement of the cardiac muscle, either as a whole or at one or more specific anatomical locations.
An indication as to whether there is prolapsing of a cardiac valve chordae tendinae.
The pattern of the epicardial vessels supplying the posterolateral and posterior descending coronary arteries.

An indication as to whether there is a new acute reduction in coronary flow (TIMI grade 0-1) in the absence of dissection, thrombus, spasm, or high-grade residual stenosis at the original PCI lesion site.
terms.preferredTerm: Coronary No Reflow at PCI Site Indicator

terms.definition: The cross sectional diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured at end ventricular diastole.
terms.preferredTerm: Cross-sectional Diameter at End Ventricular Diastole

terms.definition: The cross sectional diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured at end ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Cross-sectional Diameter at End Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: The cross sectional diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured at mid ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Cross-sectional Diameter at Mid Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: The cross-sectional thickness of a cardiovascular structure measured at end ventricular diastole.
terms.preferredTerm: Cross-sectional Thickness at End Ventricular Diastole

terms.definition: The cross-sectional thickness of a cardiovascular structure measured at end ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Cross-sectional Thickness at End Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: A measurement of a structure taken along the plane that is perpendicular to the long axis.
An indication as to whether there is doming of a cardiac valve cusp.
The assessment of the severity of doming of a cardiac valve cusp.
An indication as to whether there is a flailing cardiac valve cusp.
The assessment of the severity of a flailing cardiac valve cusp.
The time point during the cardiac cycle when the flail of one or more cardiac valve cusps occurs.
An indication as to whether there is a prolapsing cardiac valve cusp.
The assessment of the severity of a prolapsing cardiac valve cusp.
The time point during the cardiac cycle when the prolapse of one or more cardiac valve cusps occurs.
An indication as to whether there is restricted motion of a cardiac valve cusp.
The assessment of the severity of restricted motion of a cardiac valve cusp.
An indication as to whether there is tethering of a cardiac valve cusp.
The assessment of the severity of tethering of a cardiac valve cusp.
An indication as to whether there is a thickened cardiac valve cusp.
The assessment of the severity of a thickening cardiac cusp.

The type of aortic dissection present as defined by the DeBakey Classification System (DeBakey ME, Henly WS, Cooley DA, Morris GC Jr, Crawford ES, Beall AC Jr. Surgical management of dissecting aneurysms of the aorta. J Thorac Cardiovasc Surg. 1965 Jan;49:130-49).
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness. (NCI)
The ratio of the blood velocity in the left ventricular outflow tract (LVOT) to the maximum blood velocity across the aortic valve.
An indication as to whether there is the presence of blood vessel dissection.
An indication as to whether an eccentric regurgitant jet direction is present.
The ratio of the effective orifice area (EOA) to the body surface area (BSA).
The calculated estimate of the area of a cardiac valve at the point of maximum opening.
A measurement of the effective regurgitant orifice area of the valve.
The magnitude of the ejection wave that occurs when blood is ejected into the aorta by the left ventricle.
The percent reduction in the area of a given structure with the following formula: (EDA-ESA)/EDA times 100, where EDA is end diastolic area and ESA is end systolic area.
An indication as to whether there is an enlarged heart chamber.
The volume of blood remaining in a heart chamber at end ventricular diastole.
terms.preferredTerm: Heart Chamber Volume at End Ventricular Diastole
synonyms: Heart Chamber Volume, End Ventricular Diastole

terms.definition: The volume of blood remaining in a heart chamber at end ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Heart Chamber Volume at End Ventricular Systole
synonyms: Heart Chamber Volume, End Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: An indication as to whether there is re-narrowing of a stent implanted at a lesion site to treat a prior stenosis, to a diameter stenosis of greater than 50% within the stent.
An indication as to whether inferior vena cava collapse occurred with sniff.
terms.preferredTerm: Inferior Vena Cava Collapse Due to Sniff Test Indicator
terms.submissionValue: Inferior Vena Cava Collapse Sniff Ind
synonyms: Inferior Vena Cava Collapse Sniff Ind

terms.definition: An act or process of elucidation; explication, or explanation of the meaning of the event or thing via the assignment of objects from the domain to the constants of a formal language, truth-values to the proposition symbols, truth-functions to the connectives, other functions to the function symbols, and extensions to the predicates, if any. The assignments are result of human logic application and are not native to the symbols of the formal language.
The percentage of myocardial tissue which exhibits characteristics of inadequate blood flow (ischemia).
The largest cross sectional diameter of a vascular structure measured at end ventricular diastole.
terms.preferredTerm: Largest Cross-sectional Diameter at End Ventricular Diastole
synonyms: Largest Cross-sectional Diameter, End Ventricular Diastole

terms.definition: The assessment of the largest cross-sectional thickness of a tissue.
The difference between the mean minimum lumen diameter (MLD) assessed immediately after an index procedure and the MLD assessed at follow-up angiography.
The percent or fraction of the left ventricular end diastolic volume ejected during systole that can be measured by visual estimation or calculation.

A calculated estimation of the percent or fraction of the volume of blood ejected from the left ventricle during left ventricular systole, calculated as the left ventricular stroke volume divided by the left ventricular end diastolic volume.
A visual estimation of the percent or fraction of the volume of blood ejected from the left ventricle during left ventricular systole.

The reduction in the length of the end-diastolic diameter dimension that occurs between end-systole and end-diastole, expressed as a fraction of the end-diastolic dimension. Calculation of the left ventricular fractional shortening is per the following formula: [(end-diastolic dimension minus end-systolic dimension) divided by end-diastolic dimension] multiplied by 100.
The left ventricular mass divided by the subject's body surface area.

The weight of the left ventricle in grams as estimated by a formula that uses estimated measurements from echocardiographic exams, as well as constants like the specific gravity of the myocardium. Left ventricular mass is estimated using the following equation, LV Mass (g) = 0.8 {1.04[([LVEDD + IVSd + PWd]^3 - LVEDD^3)]} + 0.6, where LVEDD is LV end-diastolic dimension, IVSd is interventricular septal thickness at end-diastole, and PWd is posterior wall thickness at end-diastole.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end. (NCI)
An indication as to whether there is re-narrowing of a lesion site following treatment of a prior stenosis, to a diameter stenosis of greater than 50% at the previously treated lesion site.
A measurement of the maximum velocity of blood flow measured in the left ventricular outflow tract during left ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Left Ventricular Outflow Tract Peak Velocity
synonyms: Left Ventricular Outflow Tract Peak Velocity

terms.definition: The integral of all of the instantaneous flow velocities within the left ventricular outflow tract during left ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Left Ventricular Outflow Tract Velocity Time Integral
synonyms: Left Ventricular Outflow Tract Velocity Time Integral

terms.definition: The cross sectional diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its major axis at end ventricular diastole.
terms.preferredTerm: Major Axis Cross-sectional Diameter at End Ventricular Diastole
synonyms: Major Axis Cross-sectional Diameter, End Ventricular Diastole

terms.definition: The cross sectional diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its major axis at end ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Major Axis Cross-sectional Diameter at End Ventricular Systole
synonyms: Major Axis Cross-sectional Diameter, End Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: The cross sectional diameter of a tissue, organ, or structure measured along its major axis. (NCI)
The cross-sectional diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its major axis at mid ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Major Axis Cross-sectional Diameter at Mid Ventricular Systole
synonyms: Major Axis Cross-sectional Diameter, Mid Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: The internal diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its major axis at end ventricular diastole.
terms.preferredTerm: Major Axis Internal Diameter at End Ventricular Diastole
synonyms: Major Axis Internal Diameter, End Ventricular Diastole

terms.definition: The internal diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its major axis at end ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Major Axis Internal Diameter at End Ventricular Systole
synonyms: Major Axis Internal Diameter, End Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: The amount of matter in an object.
The quantitative measurement of the maximum separation between the parietal and visceral pericardia during diastole.
A measurement of the mean velocity of blood across an area or tissue.
The estimated average blood pressure. (NCI)
A value that represents the mean pressure gradient that exists between two points across a structure.
The mean of the inside diameters of the normal blood vessel segments.
The minimum diameter of the inside of a blood vessel (lumen) derived quantitatively in a single view.
The cross sectional diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its minor axis at end ventricular diastole.
terms.preferredTerm: Minor Axis Cross-sectional Diameter at End Ventricular Diastole
synonyms: Minor Axis Cross-sectional Diameter, End Ventricular Diastole

terms.definition: The cross sectional diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its minor axis at end ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Minor Axis Cross-sectional Diameter at End Ventricular Systole
synonyms: Minor Axis Cross-sectional Diameter, End Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: The cross sectional diameter of a tissue, organ, or structure measured along its minor axis. (NCI)
The cross-sectional diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its minor axis at mid ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Minor Axis Cross-sectional Diameter at Mid Ventricular Systole
synonyms: Minor Axis Cross-sectional Diameter, Mid Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: The internal diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its minor axis at end ventricular diastole.
terms.preferredTerm: Minor Axis Internal Diameter at End Ventricular Diastole
synonyms: Minor Axis Internal Diameter, End Ventricular Diastole

terms.definition: The internal diameter of a cardiovascular structure measured along its minor axis at end ventricular systole.
terms.preferredTerm: Minor Axis Internal Diameter at End Ventricular Systole
synonyms: Minor Axis Internal Diameter, End Ventricular Systole

terms.definition: The ratio of the peak early ventricular diastolic (E) transmitral velocity to the peak late ventricular diastolic (A) transmitral velocity.
The ratio of the peak early ventricular diastolic (E) transmitral velocity to the peak early mitral annular motion velocity (e').
A relative measurement (ratio) of the mitral regurgitant jet area to left atrial area.
terms.preferredTerm: Mitral Regurgitant Jet Area to Left Atrial Area Ratio
terms.submissionValue: Mitral Regur Jet Area L Atrial Area Rt
synonyms: Mitral Regur Jet Area L Atrial Area Rt
Mitral Regurgitant Jet Area to Left Atrial Area Ratio

terms.definition: A measurement of the volume of retrograde blood flow across the orifice of the mitral valve expressed as a percentage of the anterograde flow volume.
The measured area of the regurgitant jet of blood into the left atrium.
A measurement of the volume of retrograde blood flow across the orifice of the mitral valve.
The area of the vena contracta of the mitral valve.
The width of the vena contracta of the mitral valve.

A calculated result that uses the following base formula to quantify both systolic and diastolic ventricular function: MPI = (IVCT + IVRT)/VET, where IVCT is isovolumetric contraction time, IVRT is isovolumetric relaxation time, and VET is ventricular ejection time.
A description of what kind of intervention has been performed on a native cardiac valve.
A quantitative determination of the number of cusps composing a given cardiac valve.
Number of major epicardial vessels with greater than or equal to 70% reduction in diameter or greater than or equal to 50% reduction in cross-sectional area.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Diseased Coronary Artery Vessels

terms.definition: A description of the type of medical device that is found in a subject and is in its intended location.
terms.preferredTerm: Observed Medical Device Type In Intended Location
terms.submissionValue: Obs Med Device Type In Intended Loc
synonyms: Obs Med Device Type In Intended Loc
Observed Medical Device In The Intended Location

terms.definition: A description of the type of medical device that is found in a subject but is not in its intended location.
terms.preferredTerm: Observed Medical Device Type Not Present In Intended Location Type
terms.submissionValue: Obs Med Device Type Not In Intended Loc
synonyms: Obs Med Device Type Not In Intended Loc

terms.definition: An indication as to whether a medical or non-medical foreign body is present in a subject.
A description of the type of non-medical foreign body that is found in a subject.
The peak velocity of blood flow across a cardiac valve during late ventricular diastole (the active filling of the ventricle).
A measurement of the maximum velocity of blood across an area or tissue.
The peak velocity of blood flow across a cardiac valve during early ventricular diastole (the passive filling of the ventricle).
A value that represents the maximum pressure gradient that exists between two points across a structure.
The greatest rate of increase in peak pressure.
The value calculated as 100 x (1 - MLD/RVD), using the mean quantitative values for minimum lumen diameter (MLD) and reference vessel diameter (RVD).
An indication as to whether there is effusion between the parietal and visceral pericardia.
The qualitative description of the overall size of a pericardial effusion as assessed at the point of greatest separation between the parietal and visceral pericardia during diastole.
The amount of time required for the peak transvalvular pressure gradient to decrease to one half of the value.
A description of the type of artificial cardiac valve in use.
An indication as to whether pulmonary arterial hypertension is present.
A measurement of the volume of retrograde blood flow across the orifice of the pulmonic valve expressed as a percentage of the anterograde flow volume.
A measurement of the volume of retrograde blood flow across the orifice of the pulmonic valve.
The area of the vena contracta of the pulmonic valve.
The width of the vena contracta of the pulmonic valve.
The resistance to blood flow through the pulmonary vasculature.
The determination of whether blood flow in the pulmonary veins is greater during ventricular systole or diastole.
A relative measurement (ratio) of the pulmonic regurgitant jet width to right ventricular outflow tract (RVOT) diameter.
terms.preferredTerm: Pulmonic Regurgitant Jet Width to Right Ventricular Outflow Tract Diameter Ratio
terms.submissionValue: Pulmonic Regur Jet Width RVOT Diam Rt
synonyms: Pulmonic Regur Jet Width RVOT Diam Rt
Pulmonic Regurgitant Jet Width to Right Ventricular Outflow Tract Diameter Ratio

terms.definition: The measured width of the regurgitant jet of blood into the right ventricular outflow tract.
The distance traveled by the peak of the ventricular ejection pressure wave per unit of time.
The reflected-to-forward pressure wave amplitude ratio. (Hashimoto J et al, J Hypertens. 2008 May;26(5):1017-24)
The summation of the numerous waves being reflected by sites of impedance mismatch where central elastic arteries join more muscular arteries.

A calculated estimation of the percent or fraction of the volume of blood ejected from the right ventricle during right ventricular systole, calculated as the right ventricular stroke volume divided by the right ventricular end diastolic volume.
A visual estimation of the percent or fraction of the volume of blood ejected from the right ventricle during right ventricular systole.

The type of aortic dissection present as defined by the Stanford Classification System (Daily PO, Trueblood HW, Stinson EB, Wuerflein RD, Shumway NE. Management of acute aortic dissections. Ann Thorac Surg. 1970 Sep;10(3):237-47).
The difference in the volumes of blood between the points of maximum dilation and maximum contraction. This is the end diastolic volume minus the end systolic volume.
The resistance to blood flow through the systemic vasculature.
An indication as to whether there is systolic anterior motion of a cardiac valve and its associated structures.
The assessment of the severity of the systolic anterior motion of a cardiac valve and its associated structures.
A quantitative estimate of the pressure in a given cardiovascular structure during ventricular systole.
A relative measurement (ratio) of the tricuspid regurgitant jet area to the right atrial area.
terms.preferredTerm: Tricuspid Regurgitant Jet Area to Right Atrial Area Ratio
terms.submissionValue: Tricus Regur Jet Area R Atrial Area Rt
synonyms: Tricus Regur Jet Area R Atrial Area Rt
Tricuspid Regurgitant Jet Area to Right Atrial Area Ratio

terms.definition: A measurement of the volume of retrograde blood flow across the orifice of the tricuspid valve expressed as a percentage of the anterograde flow volume.
The measured area of the regurgitant jet of blood into the right atrium.
A measurement of the volume of retrograde blood flow across the orifice of the tricuspid valve.
The area of the vena contracta of the tricuspid valve.
The width of the vena contracta of the tricuspid valve.
The ratio of the valve area to the body surface area.
The quantitative measurement estimating the surface area of a valve.
The integral of all of the forward flow velocities during the time of blood flow across or within a specified area.
The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity. (NCI)
The extent or measurement of something from side to side. (NCI)
